item.title: Scariest Games If You Are Terrifed Of Spiders
item.description:
For most players, spiders in video games are just another type of enemy—annoying, maybe, but manageable. For arachnophobes, it’s reason enough to drop the controller, uninstall the game, and question the developer’s personal motives. There’s something about the way those eight-legged monstrosities skitter, lunge, and leer that triggers a deep, primal fear, especially when they’re rendered in high definition and designed to crawl straight into one’s nightmares.

These games didn’t just include spiders; they weaponized them. Whether it's their design, behavior, or the atmosphere they inhabit, each one makes a strong case for including a "turn off spider mode" option. Unfortunately, most of them don’t.

6 Metro: Last Light

Screaming Through the Snow

Metro: Last Light
FPS
Systems
Released
May 14, 2013
ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
4A Games
8 /10

Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

The Metro series is already anxiety-inducing thanks to its claustrophobic environments, dwindling supplies, and the constant threat of death from both mutants and radiation. But Metro: Last Light goes a step further by introducing the Nosalis spiderbugs , which are arguably the most grotesque things in a game already full of horrors. These things aren’t normal spiders. They’re mutated, irradiated beasts with armored shells and glistening legs that scuttle at impossible angles. They live in dark tunnels, thrive in the shadows, and flee from light, meaning players have to juggle their flashlight and flamethrower just to survive.

The problem is that the flashlight’s battery drains constantly, and charging it takes time. Every second the light flickers is a chance for these things to swarm. What really makes them unbearable is how they respond to fear. These creatures hiss, screech, and recoil from beams of light, giving the illusion that they’re vulnerable—until one crawls up a wall and pounces from above. The longer players spend in spider-infested tunnels, the more it feels like the game is actively punishing anyone who made the mistake of entering without a fully charged battery and a flamethrower ready to go.

5 Minecraft

Even The Blocks Can’t Save You

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
171
8.9 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Mojang
Platform(s)
3DS, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox 360
Powered by

At a glance, Minecraft doesn’t seem like it belongs on this list. It’s bright, cheerful, and made of chunky pixels. But those very same chunky pixels are responsible for ambushing countless unsuspecting players the moment the sun goes down. The spiders in Minecraft are unsettling not because they look realistic, but because they sound far too real. Their hissy, chittering audio design is unnerving in a way that completely bypasses logic and dives straight into discomfort.

They’re also huge—easily the size of the player character—and unnaturally fast when they lock onto a target.

What really pushes it over the edge for arachnophobes is their climbing ability. Walls? Trees? Vertical mineshafts? Doesn’t matter. Spiders will scale anything to get to a player, often dropping from unseen ledges in caves or crawling right up to beds in the middle of the night if the area isn’t properly lit. And since they’re one of the most common hostile mobs, there’s no escaping them, especially in survival mode, where hearing that sharp screech in a pitch-black cave never fails to spike the heart rate.

4 Hogwarts Legacy

Of All the Things Magic Could Conjure... Giant Spiders?

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
75
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Avalanche Software
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

It’s easy to assume that Hogwarts Legacy , with its picturesque castle and whimsical spellcasting, would be a cozy adventure through a beloved universe. That illusion breaks the moment players enter the Forbidden Forest. This place should come with a trigger warning, because the Acromantulas here aren’t just oversized spiders—they’re nightmare fuel, steeped in high-fidelity animation and aggressive behavior. Every twitch of their mandibles, every skitter across the mossy floor, feels designed to horrify. And the worst part? They don’t just appear in one optional side quest. They’re everywhere .

The game peppers the Scottish Highlands with spider dens, nests, and full-blown infestations. One late-game mission literally drops players into an underground lair filled with hundreds of them. There’s even a cursed chest that mimics a spider and jumpscares whoever tries to open it.

Players can technically prepare potions or fire off spells like Incendio to deal with them, but honestly, most would rather just uninstall and pretend it never happened. The devs even added an Arachnophobia Mode post-launch that turns spiders into floating boxes with roller skates—because the fear was that real.

3 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Skyrim’s Real Dragons Are Its Arachnids

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
77
9.4 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Of all the beasts that roam Skyrim’s snowy peaks, the frostbite spiders are among the most reviled—and not just by arachnophobes. Their sudden, screeching ambushes in tight Nordic ruins are enough to startle even the most hardened Dovahkiin. What makes them especially nightmarish is their variety. Some are small and quick, others are the size of horses and spit venom from a distance. The biggest ones guard dungeon chambers like grotesque bosses, hanging from ceilings or crawling across ancient walls in silence until they strike.

These spiders aren’t just window dressing. They’re a real threat in early game dungeons and often appear in narrow corridors where maneuvering is limited. Add in the fact that they can drop from above or spawn from cracked eggs mid-fight, and the experience becomes a trial in both the combat and personal willpower. While mods exist to replace them with anything from bears to mudcrabs, console players don’t get that luxury. They just get to stare into eight glistening black eyes and wonder why they picked the cave marked "Bleak Falls Barrow" on the map.

2 Limbo

Pixelated Shadows, Eight-Legged Terrors

Limbo
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
July 21, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Blood, Mild Violence
Developer(s)
Playdead
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PS Vita, Switch, PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

What makes the spider in Limbo so effective is how little it actually does—and how deeply that still manages to terrify. The game’s monochrome aesthetic strips everything down to silhouettes, and yet the spider’s hulking frame is instantly recognizable the moment it appears. There’s no fanfare, no music sting, just the slow, deliberate crawl of a massive leg from the side of the screen. And somehow, that’s worse. This creature isn’t a common enemy—it’s more like a recurring force of nature, hunting the boy through the early hours of the game.

The animations are slow and meticulous, with each movement carrying weight and menace. When it kills, it’s not quick. Players get impaled, dragged, or caught in its web, forced to wriggle helplessly as it closes in. It’s not about jump scares. It’s about dread. The kind that creeps in and sits behind your ribs as the screen dims. Limbo doesn’t rely on gore or high-detail textures—it just presents something fundamentally wrong and refuses to let players look away.

1 Grounded

The Spider That Ate The Backyard

Grounded
Survival
Systems
Released
September 27, 2022
ESRB
Teen // Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment

Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Nothing—and this is no exaggeration—compares to the sheer nightmare fuel that is Grounded ’s wolf spider. It’s the kind of enemy that makes players scream before they even realize why they’re screaming. Blame the scale. Grounded shrinks players to the size of an ant and turns the backyard into a survival horror gauntlet. That weed stem? A tree. That beetle? A boss fight. That spider? A god.

Wolf spiders in Grounded don’t just wander around. They prowl . They stalk through the tall grass, their footsteps shaking the camera, their eyes glowing in the dark. Their hitboxes are massive, they one-shot undergeared players, and worst of all, they’re silent until it’s too late.

Hiding in a leaf hut doesn’t help. They can find their way in. They will find their way in. And then there’s the orb weavers, which are slower but just as terrifying. They build webs across common paths, forcing players to either fight through or reroute entirely. Arachnophobes who tried the game at launch begged Obsidian for an accessibility option, and the devs answered with one of the most famous arachnophobia sliders in gaming. At zero, spiders become floating blobs. At max, they’re back to full horror. The fact that players still flinch at the halfway setting says it all.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games That Break The Fourth Wall, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games can be more memorable with fourth-wall-breaking elements that directly appeal to players.
  • The Simpsons: Hit & Run, Borderlands 2, and Halo Infinite include amusing fourth-wall-breaking dialogue and interactions.
  • The Sims 3, Pathologic, The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind, and GTA: San Andreas feature characters and interactions that break the fourth wall.

Immersion has always been something that many players prioritize in their video games, and open-world titles are no exception here. However, that shouldn't stop developers from trying different things with their titles, such as breaking the fourth wall.

If done correctly, some open-world games become all the more memorable when they address the player directly or acknowledge their existence as a video game. The best ones of the lot are excellent video games in their own right, with some interesting fourth-wall-breaking shenanigans.

8 The Simpsons: Hit & Run

An Open-World Game With A Focus On Comedy Has Several Fourth-Wall-Breaking Zingers

The Simpsons: Hit & Run
7.5 /10
Released
September 16, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
3+
Powered by

Fourth-wall breaks would feel right at home in a Simpsons video game, and Hit & Run is no exception. Players control the members of this eponymous family who have several hilarious zingers, including ones that acknowledge the fact that they're in a video game.

Marge pretty much alludes to this when choosing missions, pedestrians will comment on their sad nature as a generic character if they're run over, and Kang & Kodos sit through the credits to comment on them. These are just a few of the many zingers that make this nostalgic GTA clone such a blast to play through.

7 Borderlands 2

The Characters And Enemies Have Amusing Dialogue That Breaks The Fourth Wall

Borderlands 2
8 /10
14
8.9 /10
Released
September 18, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Borderlands 2 was when the humor of the series' writing was at its peak. This made the fourth-wall breaks all the more notable, especially when it comes to the idling dialogue of characters like Zer0 and Gaige.

Claptrap makes a hilarious comment about certain items being for the player characters if his stash is uncovered, and Gaige becomes more and more unhinged as she gains more Anarchy. Finally, the iconic psychos also have fourth-wall-breaking dialogue that adds to the charm of this shooter.

6 Halo Infinite

The Grunts Have Amusing Dialogue

Halo Infinite
9 /10
19
8.2 /10
Released
December 8, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

By pursuing an open-world structure, Halo Infinite gave enemies in the game more character than ever before. A notable example includes the grunts, who will go so far as to break the fourth wall at times.

They'll whistle the Halo tune before commenting on how they hate the song and make jokes about the series' convoluted numbered and spinoff releases. Sometimes, they'll even talk about how Master Chief is psychic and how they must plug the controller as Player 2 to defeat them, which is an obvious nod to Psycho Mantis from Metal Gear Solid .

5 Pathologic

The Game's Perfect Ending Sees The Developer Directly Addressing The Player

Pathologic
Survival
Horror
Systems
Released
June 9, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Pathologic is one of the best and most bizarre horror games that any fan of unique open-world titles should check out. Players control one of many protagonists in a town that is slowly wasting away courtesy of a mysterious plague.

The game boasts several unique endings, including the perfect ending that goes super meta. Players finally ascend a mysterious structure they've seen in the sky, only to find the models of children serving as proxies for the developers who address the player directly in one of the weirdest video game endings of all time, which is perfectly on brand for a game like Pathologic .

4 Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii

Majima Tells The Player To Take A Bathroom Break While Recapping Chapter 1

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii
7.3 /10
Released
February 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Goro Majima is one of the most beloved and unhinged characters in the Yakuza series, which is why it's only fitting that he would break the fourth wall in his spinoff title. Fans know that every Yakuza game features a recap at the end of every chapter, and Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is no exception.

While recapping the events of Chapter 1, Majima surprises players by telling them to go for a bathroom break before the story continues. It's completely out of left field and illustrates yet again why fans love this Yakuza character to bits.

3 The Sims 3

Like Other Games In The Series, Sims Will Get Mad And Start Signalling The Player When Their Needs Are Low

The Sims 3
8.0 /10
Released
June 2, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Crude Humor, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

The Sims 3 is one of the greatest video games ever made, implementing an open world for the first time in the series that was sorely missed in the sequel. Players will love controlling a virtual family and helping their chosen characters find happiness.

However, there are times when some Sims are so low on needs that they'll directly complain to the player and wave their hands. It's one of the many quirky things in The Sims franchise that illustrate why fans go crazy over this life simulation series.

2 The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

Characters Like M'aiq The Liar & Vivec Break The Fourth Wall

The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
9.3 /10
Released
May 1, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Powered by

The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind is one of the best and most important video games ever made, setting the foundation that future Bethesda titles would build upon. It also introduced a character named M'aiq the Liar, who serves as a stand-in for the developers and references the franchise's past while also mixing in his fair share of half-truths and outright lies.

Another interesting way Morrowind breaks the fourth wall is with Vivec, with the implication being that this character attained godhood by realizing that he was in a video game. Other dialogue alludes to everything from the save-load mechanic to the developer console and everything in between.

1 Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

Gant Bridge Has Some Amusing Meta Quotes

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
111
8.7 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

The Grand Theft Auto games have never shied away from breaking the fourth wall with their easter eggs, and San Andreas is no exception. If players reach the top of Gant Bridge on a jetpack, then they'll find a message saying that there are no easter eggs to be found here.

Along with this, there's a board near the bridge with meta details about the polygons of the bridge, the disc space it takes, and other development details. While the remasters of these games were criticized to kingdom come, the developer still made it a point to update this information and make it relevant for this version of San Andreas .

item.title: Starfield Surpasses Another Popular Bethesda Game on Nexus Mods
item.description:
Starfield has surpassed The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind in the number of downloads on Nexus Mods. Starfield was released in 2023, and one of the game's main appeals is the variety of native content due to the impressive number of systems to explore. However, this potential goes even further with the ability to install mods.

Players who want to enhance their Starfield experience by installing mods have a vast list of options to choose from. Back in 2024, a Starfield mod addressed a major complaint from players by replacing elevator loading screens with working elevators. Earlier this year, a mod that adds 300 missions to Starfield was shared by a community member, offering new content such as deliveries, manufacturing, and fights against Infestations. There is a lot to do in Starfield , and even more with the help of mods. Thanks to this feature, Bethesda's game has reached an impressive milestone.

Starfield surpassed The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind and became the 12th most downloaded game on Nexus Mods. The information was shared on the Starfield subreddit by user taosecurity, showing that Bethesda's RPG has reached 90.6 million downloads – a number that now stands at 90.7 million. They say the game has around two times more downloads than Mount and Blade 2: Bannerlord mods, so they expect it won't be long before it surpasses TaleWorlds Entertainment's title. Starfield had already surpassed another well-known game in early May, amassing more mod downloads than Capcom's Monster Hunter World .

Starfield's Relationship With Mods

Although Starfield now supports mods, it did not officially arrive at launch. Instead, it arrived only in early 2024 when Bethesda released the Creation Kit. Now, the game has over 10,800 mods hosted on Nexus Mods, including popular downloads such as tools to enable automatic looting of ship debris, improve the inventory screen, and make the game run more smoothly. Despite this, modders are losing interest in Starfield .

Bethesda's expectations for Starfield were high, with plans to release annual DLC. The Shattered Space expansion dropped in September 2024, telling a new story set in the city of Dazra, but since then, Starfield has not received any other DLC. However, the game continues to receive updates, the most recent one having dropped at the end of May. Despite the lukewarm reception to the DLC, plans can always change, so players hope that Bethesda will breathe new life into Starfield with the release of a second expansion.

item.title: Mecha BREAK: Complete Achievement Guide
item.description:
As an ace pilot in Mecha BREAK , your mission is to command a powerful mech, known as a Striker. With multiple game modes and a diverse lineup of Striker mechs, there are plenty of things to learn and master. If you really want to prove yourself as the ultimate mech commander, you’ll want to collect all 61 achievements. These achievements are tied to specific feats across combat performance, teamwork, and mission success. The following guide breaks down all the achievements you can win across the various game modes in Mecha BREAK .

How to Get All Achievements in Mecha BREAK

Currently, Mecha Break has no console trophies, but you can earn achievements on PC via Steam . Here’s a complete list of all 61 achievements and how to get them:

Name

Objective

How To Get

ACE I

Win 3 battles in Ace Arena

To get the ACE trophies, you need to win matches in Ace Arena (3v3 team deathmatch).

ACE II

Win 15 battles in Ace Arena

ACE III

Win 45 battles in Ace Arena

Ascendant I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Oak

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Ascendant II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Oak

BREAK Striker I

Win a battle in Operation VERGE

Win the required number of battles in the Operation VERGE 6v6 objective-based mode.

BREAK Striker II

Win 5 battles in Operation VERGE

BREAK Striker III

Win 10 battles in Operation VERGE

Comrade I

Achieve Top Assist once in Operation VERGE

Be the player with the most assists on your team at the end of an Operation VERGE match. You can do this easily with a sniper mech.

Comrade II

Achieve Top Assist six times in Operation VERGE

Bringer of Peace I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Misra Matrix

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Bringer of Peace II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Misra Matrix

Bushido I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Kamiya Heavy Industries

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Bushido II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Kamiya Heavy Industries

Cloudpiercer I

Extract 20 items from Mashmak

Gather and extract the required number of items successfully in the Mashmak extraction shooter mode.

Cloudpiercer II

Extract 100 items from Mashmak

Cloudpiercer III

Extract 500 items from Mashmak

Demon Hunter I

Neutralize 3 Troopships in Mashmak

To get these trophies, you need to neutralize the required number of Troopships in the Mashmak map.

Demon Hunter II

Neutralize 15 Troopships in Mashmak

Demon Hunter III

Neutralize 90 Troopships in Mashmak

Contracted Consultant I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Bifrost

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Contracted Consultant II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Bifrost

Expert I

Achieve Best Tactic once in Operation VERGE

To unlock the Expert trophies, you must be the player with the "Best Tactic" on your team at the end of an Operation VERGE match.

Expert II

Achieve Best Tactic six times in Operation VERGE

Finisher I

Achieve Top Finisher once in Operation VERGE

Achieve the "Top Finisher" commendation in Operation VERGE matches by securing the most final blows or kills against enemy Strikers.

Finisher II

Achieve Top Finisher six times in Operation VERGE

Heart of the Brave I

Neutralize 1 Colossal Target in Mashmak

Neutralize the required number of Colossal Targets (mini-bosses) in Mashmak. They’re heavily armored with unique attack patterns.

Heart of the Brave II

Neutralize 6 Colossal Targets in Mashmak

Heart of the Brave III

Neutralize 25 Colossal Targets in Mashmak

Honorary Lunarian I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Lunar-mare

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Honorary Lunarian II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Lunar-mare

Immunis I

Extract from Mashmak once

Successfully extract from the Mashmak game mode the required number of times to get these trophies.

Immunis II

Extract from Mashmak 5 times

Immunis III

Extract from Mashmak 30 times

Ironclad I

Achieve Highest Damage Taken once in Operation VERGE

Achieve the "Highest Damage Taken" commendation the required number of times in Operation VERGE. To do this, focus on playing a tanky mech with high defense and health.

Ironclad II

Achieve Highest Damage Taken six times in Operation VERGE

MVP I

Achieve MVP once in Operation VERGE

Achieve the MVP commendation the required number of times in Operation VERGE. The MVP is awarded to the top-performing player who scores the most merit points.

MVP II

Achieve MVP six times in Operation VERGE

Knight of Honor I

Complete 1 mission assigned by the Cygnia Union

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Knight of Honor II

Complete 3 missions assigned by the Cygnia Union

Neutralize Threat I

Destroy 3 Corite Extractors in Mashmak

Destroy the required number of Corite Extractors in the Mashmak game mode. These Extractors are stationary objectives that appear on the map and are often defended by AI enemies.

Neutralize Threat II

Destroy 15 Corite Extractors in Mashmak

Neutralize Threat III

Destroy 90 Corite Extractors in Mashmak

PyroGenesis Test Pilot I

Complete 1 mission assigned by PyroGenesis

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

PyroGenesis Test Pilot II

Complete 3 missions assigned by PyroGenesis

Scout Cavalry I

Complete 1 mission assigned by the Vulturia Alliance

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Scout Cavalry II

Complete 3 missions assigned by the Vulturia Alliance

Soul of Steel I

Accumulate 3,000 Mission Points in Mashmak

Earn the required number of Mission Points in the Mashmak game mode. Mission Points are earned by completing the various objectives that pop up during the match. The most efficient way to get these points is to complete as many of these objectives as possible in a single run.

Soul of Steel II

Accumulate 18,000 Mission Points in Mashmak

Soul of Steel III

Accumulate 70,000 Mission Points in Mashmak

Test Pilot

Complete all basic challenges for ALYSNES

Complete all the basic challenges for the Alysnes Striker. These challenges are essentially a tutorial for the mech, teaching you how to use its basic abilities and weapons.

Top Agent I

Complete 1 mission assigned by the Thalassic Federation

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Top Agent II

Complete 3 missions assigned by the Thalassic Federation

Top Gun I

Achieve Ace once in Operation VERGE

Get the "Ace" commendation in Operation VERGE by eliminating the enemy team without dying.

Top Gun II

Achieve Ace 6 times in Operation VERGE

Top-tier Informant I

Complete 1 mission assigned by Circulus Sea

These are optional objectives you can select from the Tactical Station on the main menu.

Top-tier Informant II

Complete 3 missions assigned by Circulus Sea

Warblade I

Achieve Top Assault once in Operation VERGE

Earn the "Top Assault" commendation up to six times in Operation VERGE by scoring the highest out of all attacker mechs in the game.

Warblade II

Achieve Top Assault 6 times in Operation VERGE

Triple Kill I

Achieve Triple Kill once in Operation VERGE

Get Triple Kills in Operation VERGE by eliminating 3 enemies in a single life. Use burst or AoE mechs and target grouped or low-health enemies.

Triple Kill II

Achieve Triple Kill 6 times in Operation VERGE

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Roblox: GHOUL://RE Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • GHOUL://RE Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for GHOUL://RE
  • How to Get More GHOUL RE CODES

GHOUL://RE is one of many Roblox games that were inspired by the popular manga and anime series Tokyo Ghoul . Unlike a lot of the others, it focuses mainly on PvP combat, helping to provide players with a unique and intense experience that few other games on the platform can match.

Roblox players who are looking to gain an advantage can redeem GHOUL://RE codes to get free Ghoul Points and other great in-game rewards. The following guide contains a list of all of the latest codes for GHOUL://RE and will be updated whenever any new ones are added to the game.

Updated July 12, 2025, by Tom Bowen: The Cochlea Event introduced a bunch of new features, and also three new GHOUL RE codes. By redeeming Cochlea! , Augments! , and fixeskurona! , players can get 1,000 Ghoul Points. After doing so, they should bookmark this page so that they can check back here from time to time, as we're always looking out for more new codes for GHOUL RE and will add any that we find to the list below.

GHOUL://RE Codes

All Working GHOUL RE Codes

  • fixeskurona! - Redeem code for 200 Ghoul Points (NEW)
  • Augments! - Redeem code for 400 Ghoul Points (NEW)
  • Cochlea! - Redeem code for 400 Ghoul Points (NEW)
  • Compensation! - Redeem code for 300 Ghoul Points
  • EventMilestone - Redeem code for 500 Ghoul Points
  • QoLChanges - Redeem code for 500 Ghoul Points
  • Saiko! - Redeem code for 300 Ghoul Points
  • refcallatimeoutihaveajob - Redeem code for 1,000 Ghoul Points
  • henotsavingnunLOL - Redeem code for 800 Ghoul Points
  • ourmistakesorry - Redeem code for 300 Ghoul Points

How to Redeem Codes for GHOUL://RE

The process for redeeming codes in GHOUL://RE is very similar to the ones found in other Roblox games, so experienced players shouldn't have too much trouble figuring it out for themselves. However, for those who are new to the platform or anybody in need of a refresher, the following step-by-step instructions should help.

  1. Launch GHOUL://RE .
  2. Click on the > button at the top of the screen.
  3. Type or paste one of the working GHOUL://RE from the list above into the gray box.
  4. Press enter or click the Confirm button to redeem the code.

How to Get More GHOUL RE CODES

The best place to find all of the latest GHOUL://RE codes is right here, as we'll update this guide whenever a new one becomes available. However, fans of the game may also want to join the official GHOUL://RE Discord server and become a member of the game's community group, as new Roblox promo codes are sometimes revealed there first before appearing elsewhere.
